Package lex

Class Lexer

java.lang.Object
lex.Lexer
public class Lexer extends Object
A simple lexer (very inefficient). Whitespace between tokens is discarded. Major limitation: the lexer only works with files and it starts by reading the entire file contents into memory (so it will fail for very large files).

  • Constructor Details

    • Lexer

      public Lexer(String[][] definitions)
      Initialise a new lexer. Token definitions are provided as an array of String arrays, where each String array must be of length 2, of the form {token-type-name, regex}. A token-type name is required to be a non-empty sequence of upper-case letters and underscores, starting with an upper-case letter. The regex must use the syntax defined in java.util.regex.Pattern.
      Parameters:
      definitions - the token definitions
      See Also:
      • Pattern

  • Method Details

    • readFile

      public void readFile(String filePath) throws IOException
      Read in the contents of a file and initialise the lexer, ready to start producing tokens. Remember to call next() before calling tok().
      Parameters:
      filePath - the file to be lexed
      Throws:
      IOException - if the specified file does not exist or cannot be read

    • next

      public void next()
      Advance to the next token in the token stream.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the head token is already EOF.
      Error - if none of the token specs match.

    • tok

      public Token tok()
      The token currently at the head of the token stream. If the end of the token stream has been reached, this will be the EOF token.
      Returns:
      the head token
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if next() has never been called.
